title: 'Block Everything': While September 10 movement echoes the Yellow Vests, it also has key differences
subhead: While the call to 'block everything' on Wednesday, September 10, brings to mind the Yellow Vest protests of 2018, the choice of a weekday, the involvement of unions, and the support of left-wing parties give this social movement its own distinct character.

Russia hits seat of Ukraine government in war's biggest air attack
UK police arrest 890 people at Palestine Action demonstration
subhead: The Metropolitan Police said they had arrested 890 people protesting in London in support of Palestine Action, which was proscribed in July by the government, a move critics have said is a threat to free speech.

title: Will France's government collapse? Do the math with our simulator
subhead: To survive the confidence vote on September 8, Prime Minister François Bayrou must secure a majority of votes cast in the Assemblée Nationale. Abstentions and absences will not be counted.
byline: By Pierre Breteau and Maxime Vaudano

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear band T-shirts?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: Isabelle Adjani's puzzling career, from disappearances to spectacular comebacks
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (6/6). Since the success of 'L'Eté Meurtrier' ('One Deadly Summer') in 1983, the actress has continually alternated between periods of intense activity and long breaks. If her career is hard to decipher, its diverse output attests to her genius for the trade.

title: Isabelle Adjani, the masterfully ambiguous Queen Margot
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (5/6). After four years of hesitation that gave the director Patrice Chéreau many sleepless nights, the actress finally agreed to act in this bloody adaptation of an Alexandre Dumas novel.

title: 'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.

title: France's best art exhibitions this fall, in Paris and beyond
